text:
> precompilation is multi-processed, as opposed to multi-threaded, so is not limited by Julia’s >thread count. By default, Julia will spawn a maximum CPU-balanced load of package >precompile jobs at once based on the number of CPU cores
:joy: Will my cluster managers kill me when they notice that I am spawning 100 julia instances during precompilation in a login node? If it is ultra fast they shouldn’t notice.

text: Do we have an easy way to limit the number of cores precompilation uses?

elements.text: Do we have an easy way to limit the number of cores precompilation uses?

attachments.title: Julia v1.6.0 has been released
attachments.text: There is the JULIA_NUM_PRECOMPILE_TASKS env variable that you can set. Unfortunately, it doesn’t seem to be documented right now.
attachments.fallback: JuliaLang: Julia v1.6.0 has been released
